comment._content: A stunning photo! -- made me 'wanna drive out there. Then, I read (with apologies to Paul Harvey) 'The Rest of the Story' ;) Stormy history of Florida's Pigeon Key Tours of the isolated island include an overview of the 1935 hurricane that turned Pigeon Key into a ghost town and killed 423 people, many of them WWI vets.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pixelwrangler] Tragically, Pigeon Key sat right in the path of one of the strongest hurricanes in recorded history. Here is an aerial shot of the rescue train that failed to reach the vets on Labor Day 1935: www.floridamemory.com/items/show/149572.
